page.text: Gregg Watts
124 Raymond Avenue | Poughkeepsie, New York 12604 | 610 764 6094 | grwatts@vassar.edu
Bachelor of Arts in Economics and Political Science, GPA: 3.73 / 4.0
May 2015
Vassar College Senior Class Exec. Council, 2015 Treasurer elected to manage and allocate a $51,000 budget
Vassar Student Association Finance Committee, Appointed to a select group to distribute $830,000 on campus
Co-founder of Brewer Investment Group, Organize and lead an organization focused on mock equity

text.i: Two NCAA appearances and Liberty League All-Academic Team

page.text: Relevant Coursework: Macroeconomics, Microeconomics, Probability & Statistics, US Economic Issues,
Calculus, Industrial Organization, Comparative Political Economy, Comparative Economics, International Finance

text.b: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

page.text: September 2013 – June 2014
LSE Student Staff Liaison Committee, Appointed to channel comments, questions, and student life discussion

text.i: Attended career events and networking sessions to gain industry insight and expertise

page.text: Principles of Finance, Politics of Economic Policy, Further Quantitative Methods, Economy, Society, and Space

text.b: W. H. Reaves & Company / Reaves Asset Management

page.text: June 2014 – August 2014
Contributed buy-side research and valuation analysis by creating, updating, and expanding twelve financial models
across the energy, telecommunications, and utilities infrastructure sectors in which the Firm specializes
Tracked Analyst's investment theses in all of the Firm's research meeting reports and presented financial metrics
Reported on second quarter earnings for eleven companies, providing notes on results and developments
Compiled and presented materials and a multi-year model for Canadian National Railway (CNI), including a
position recommendation, as well as an upside, downside, and target price using projections and multiples
March 2014 – May 2014
Conducted industry and region-wide research for business development initiatives primarily in the United Arab
Emirates while facilitating financial plans to achieve a start-up's social finance investment impact related to autism
Created informational briefs to profile the industry, important political figures, and high-impact investors
Worked within a small team with the ultimate aim of preparing for a global capital raise in the second half of 2015

text.b: American Family Life Assurance Corporation of Columbus (AFLAC)

page.text: August 2013 – September 2013
Managed communication and cold-calling with prospective candidates while also controlling recruiting database

text.i: Intern to the Director of Development

page.text: July 2013 – September 2013
Analyzed financials of potential donors and created a master catalogue based on the cross-fit of philanthropic and
community-oriented goals and the Foundation’s programmatic needs, alongside grant approval deadlines
Vassar College Political Science Department, Academic Intern nominated and appointed by Department faculty
MacroDigest, Editor for 3 months for a global macroeconomic press/blogs aggregator for systematic news
The Tananbaum Family Leadership Program for Work and Development, Selected for a year-long fellowship
2014 Julia Flittner Lamb Prize, Selected for outstanding work in political science as a rising Vassar senior
Omicron Delta Epsilon International Economics Student Honor Society, Selected as a member
Strong writer, proficient in Spanish, experienced travelling internationally, Bloomberg certified
